compounddef.title: Tutorial: Default Galerkin with explicit time stepping

simplesect.para: This tutorial shows how to create and solve a default time-explicit Galerkin problem.

sect1.title: What is a default Galerkin problem?
sect1.para: pressio4py supports different variants of Galerkin, as we will show in subsequent tutorials. The "default" qualification refers to a formulation that does not use hyper-reduction. Suppose that your full-order model (FOM) is written as \[ \frac{d \boldsymbol{y}}{dt} = \boldsymbol{f}(\boldsymbol{y},t; \boldsymbol{\mu}), \quad \boldsymbol{y}(0;\boldsymbol{\mu}) = \boldsymbol{y}(\boldsymbol{\mu}), \]
